review_text: My husband & I stayed at the Hawk’s Nest for our anniversary. It was a unique experience & very peaceful. The view from the balcony overlooking the creek was beautiful & the hot tub was relaxing. We took advantage of the fire pit & charcoal grill as well. The bathroom situation didn’t bother us at all & is easy to use if you read the instructions. If you’re looking for a relaxing getaway surrounded by nature, the Hawk’s Nest is the spot! If you don’t like nature, can’t walk up/down gravel slopes, don’t like outdoor bathrooms or being in the middle of nowhere, this place probably isn’t for you. There is no TV or wifi but the cell phone signal picked up just fine (AT&T & T-Mobile). The arrowhead trail down to the creek was grown up so we didn’t attempt hiking down there but more adventurous couples may enjoy it. The host Christy was accommodating & sweet! Only con: it’s a little pricey for budget travelers.

Nice and cozy home. Clean and comfortable. 99% as described.
We did have an issue streaming shows on the TV's in the living room and upstairs bedroom. They had problems connecting to the wifi and staying connected. The TV in the downstairs bedroom worked. No antenna for local channels.
There are some cosmetic issues on the interior such as missing grout near the bottom in the shower and popping and peeling paint on a few of the walls. As a handyman I see the paint issues quite often in older homes with plaster walls.
I also noticed the lack of smoke and carbon monoxide detectors. There is an empty mounting ring on the kitchen ceiling that peaked my interest. After searching through the house, I found the detector on the second floor was newer but had a dead battery and the detector on the first floor was a year from expiring and contained no batteries. This is definately a code violation for any short term rental. Something the homeowner should be mindful of.

review_text: This cabin was beautiful! It sits on the bluff which feels like a treehouse from inside. Christy communicated well with us from start to finish. The cabin is laid out nice for a small space and decorated well. Parking was easy and convenient. We also loved the deck with the stunning view! I would strongly suggest reading the fine print extensively and more than once though. My only complaint is that there are zero coverings for the wall of windows facing the deck nor the window over the kitchen sink (this is listed in the listing details but we missed it). We felt a little open and exposed knowing that there were other cabins close by. I could see the cabin next door and their car through the kitchen window so I assumed they could potentially see me. Since it’s all one big open space, we felt like it wasn’t private except in the bathroom where we could shut a door. The sun also rises directly through the wall of windows. It is a gorgeous sun rise through the trees, but we wanted to sleep in and were up at 5:15am due to no way to block the sun at all. Our desire was to stay our night in a place where we could rest and refresh with some extra sleep after a day of driving which unfortunately wasn’t the turnout. I am sad that we won’t be staying here again for this reason. For the price of this cabin, I feel that an option to cover the windows should absolutely be included, no matter how gorgeous the sunrise is.

Larry’s home was perfect for our stay! A nice, updated 50’s style home, reminiscent of grandma’s homestead (without the clutter 😉). The bedrooms were large with wonderfully comfortable beds. The added tv in the master was a nice addition although not used in our case. Access to a large laundry room with supplies was nice also. The kitchen was a little small, but well-equipped. The Keurig with a hand full of samples was easy to operate. There was also a nice little screened porch out back that would’ve been perfect for a coffee quiet time, if only there was time. 😉
Overall, I would highly recommend Larry’s place. His communication was exemplary The best part was that the home was only a block from the magnificent lake with a nice park with tables and a front row seat to a flock of Canadian geese and their chicks.
A side note, my daughter and I came up from Fl to do some hiking post-grad decompression 😁. The first day, we went to Bethel Spring/falling Sink which was a moderate 2mile trail to a lovely waterfall. The second day, we hiked Stephen’s Gap (listed as 1.4miles, but seemed longer). This was extremely challenging and you have to sign a waiver and agree to wear helmets etc, but the cave/waterfall were amazing to see! Both trails were about 30 minutes from the house and the scenery en route was so serene and beautiful as it was accompanied by open fields, wild flowers, livestock and horses. In all, I would give Guntersville a five star rating for a peaceful vacation destination.
